DOC.brief_summary: This study aim establish incidence residual paralysis patient follow administration mini- dose atracurium ( less ED95 i.e . < 0.23mg/kg < 15 mg patient ) supraglottic airway insertion correlate duration time drug administration arrival PACU . The secondary aim compare incidence residual paralysis patient receive full dos atracurium ( per body weight ) receive mini-doses .
DOC.brief_title: Assessment Residual Paralysis Patients Who Receive Mini-dose Atracurium During Supraglottic Airway Insertion
DOC.detailed_description: Post-operative residual paralysis may define incomplete recovery muscle function follow intra-operative administration neuromuscular blocker ( NMBs ) . This condition associate many negative patient outcome : increase risk aspiration ; upper airway obstruction ; delay Post-Anaesthetic Care Unit ( PACU ) discharge , amongst others . Despite increase use shorter act agent , prevalence residual paralysis PACU remain high 20-50 % . NMBs commonly use facilitate endotracheal intubation insertion supraglottic airway obtund airway reflex . Given increase use mini-dose NMBs without post-operative reversal clinical practice , need evaluate incidence residual paralysis patient population receive mini-dose atracurium supraglottic airway insertion .
DOC.criteria: Adults 21 year old Received either minidose atracurium full dose atracurium placement supraglottic airway Did receive neuromuscular reversal agent point operation . Patients underlie neuromuscular disease Patients receive preoperative medication may affect neuromuscular transmission Patients require additional dos neuromuscular blockade point operation
